intro: Calochortus ciliatus, commonly known as the Sierra mariposa lily, is a species of flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its showy, cup-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and open habitats, such as meadows and woodlands. Its leaves are basal, lance-shaped, and often covered in fine hairs. Calochortus ciliatus is a perennial herb that blooms in late spring to early summer.
